story

Class Narrator

  • Object
    • story.Narrator

  • public class Narrator
extends Object
    This class takes care of describing what is happening in the story events of our game. It is much easier to keep track of all the parts of our story in one place: this class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Narrator() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean isAtFinalChapter()
      Checks if the Narrator is ready to end its story.
      static void setData(DataManager data)
      Connect to the same data instance used by the Game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Narrator

        public Narrator()

    • Method Detail

      • setData

        public static void setData(DataManager data)
        Connect to the same data instance used by the Game. So the Narrator can know what the player's name is, and whether they have died or not.
        Parameters:
        data - Should pass in the same data instance used by the Game.

      • tell

        public static String[] tell()
        A method to get the different parts of our story. Each time this method is executed, the chapter number advances by one value. Extend the given code, or you could design your story to behave in a completely different way if you want. For example, creating descriptions of your story or character dialogue as strings in an array or collection, and choosing parts of it in different ways, perhaps partly random.
        Returns:
        An array of string descriptions.

      • isAtFinalChapter

        public static boolean isAtFinalChapter()
        Checks if the Narrator is ready to end its story. This helps Game know what to do next. Perhaps you could check similarly for other chapters?
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Narrator is currently about to tell the final chapter in the story, and false otherwise.
